bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, August 10, 1922

div1.p: Rose sends Carter English and Spanish versions of an article by White on yellow fever. He mentions two cases of yellow fever in Mexico, which White and Connor are investigating.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, August 10, 1922

August 10, 1922
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am inclosing both English and Spanish versions
of an article which Doctor White has submitted to the Consejo
for publication with a view that the average practitioner
in Mexico might have something of a guide in the epidemiology
of yellow fever. Doctor White has requested that these
papers be forwarded to you for expression of opinion as to
the value of the article, or for any suggestions or altera-
tions you may desire to make.

A recent case of yellow fever has made appearance
at Panuco near Tampico; both Doctor White and Doctor Connor
are on the ground; no other cases have been reported to date.

I plan to get away from the office this week, and
shall be on vacation until the last of September. I hope
that your work on the history of yellow fever is not inter-
fering with your own vacation.
With best wishes for a happy summer, I am
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor Henry R. Carter
Care Mrs. Lloyd Noland
776 Parkway
Fairfield, Alabama
